Oh I know what that guy was talking about... I think in Feb I did audit-sysprep stuff. Yah that speeds up installs but it also causes problems for some people.

Anyhow X17-59465.iso is (Digital River Retail Media Refresh Ult-SP1). MS contracted Digital River to host file downloads for retail editions of things. They have Win7 stuff, Office retail stuff, etc.

Back in Win7, there wasn't much of a difference between retail and msdn versions. In Win8, there's a huge difference and you cannot integrate the downloaded versions because they contain an encrypted .esd install file instead of .wim.

OK after reading Microsoft's comments about said kb file you mentioned, I'll re-do this month's ultimate releases without the kb file 2823324.

It appears to replace the ntfs kernel driver or something... I didn't read every word, just skimmed, but it seems as though it could cause problems for people who use certain kinds of software.

So I'll re-do the ultimate releases, then drop an AIO a day or two later after seeding ultimate.

ancient, I'm sorry I was working on win7 reversion and the aio. I was pre-occupied.

If you do not have any problems, there's really no reason to be concerned. The newer version will simply not have the kb file that updates the ntfs kernel stuff.  From what I can tell it only affects some high-security stuff like banking software. I haven't really gotten 100% of the details.

So yah, it's totally not necessary to use the v2 I am doing if you are not having any problems.
